channel.title: My Ideas
channel.description:
These are just a few of my ideas for things I'd like to add to a client, but haven't quite figured out how to add them. I'd appreciate any tips or feedback.
[b]1. Custom Packets[/b] This could enable us to send new things we couldn't send before such as: We could update the tool-tip text, change settings in the client, etc.
[b]2. Interfaces with text-input[/b] This would enable us to create interfaces with brand new purposes. We could create survey interfaces, password recovery interfaces, etc. all within the client.
[b]3. Video support[/b] In a lot of games, a story line has a video telling part of the story. If we could find a way to play a video of a story, I think that would be pretty cool.
Thanks for reading!
(If this is in the wrong section/anything is wrong with it feel free to Lock/Delete)

item.title: My Ideas
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:12, topic:431165”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=533845.msg3905073#msg3905073 date=1328146662]

For the cut scene, I was just thinking about using the camera movement update, with some scripted player/npc interactions, blacked out minimap, etc.

There’s a cache index for this.

Oh really? So all of the cutscenes are set in the cache?

It was fairly recent, but yes. Sorta.

Is it only for the newer clients, or did this exist in the RT3 engine as well? I haven’t seen anything like that yet in the client I’m looking at.
[/quote]

Solely RT5.[/quote]

Ah okay; I thought I was missing something in front of me >.>

Read full topic

item.title: My Ideas
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“hihid27, post:6, topic:431165”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=533845.msg3902998#msg3902998 date=1327948591]
All of those things (can) already exist. Although, the new packets need to be added manually.
[/quote]
I like your cut scene idea… I didn’t think of doing it that way.

Do you have any suggestion on how you would make a “text box” in an interface?[/quote]

If you mean a simple single line text input, there’s already a chatbox interface for that.

For anything more than that, you’ll have to create your own interface.

Read full topic

In a lot of games, a story line has a video telling part of the story. If we could find a way to play a video of a story, I think that would be pretty cool.

Thanks for reading!
